newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium probes Mobutu assets at Congo request.
newsitem.headline: Belgium probes Mobutu assets at Congo request.

text.p: A Belgian judge searched the offices of two banks in Brussels on Wednesday in connection with allegations of money laundering by former Zairean leader Mobutu Sese Seko and relatives, the Belgian news agency Belga said.
It said investigating judge Jean-Claude Leys started the action at the request of the prosecutor general of the Democratic Republic of Congo (the former Zaire.
A Belgian Foreign Ministry spokesman confirmed a letter had been received from the Congolese prosecutor general.

"On Saturday minister Bizima Karaha, the (Congolese) Minister of Foreign Affairs, who was en route to Washington, was received at the Foreign Ministry and handed (us) a letter from the prosecutor general," the spokesman said.
It was sent on to the Justice Ministry. "It involved a cross-border case," he said, giving no details of the contents.
Belga said the offices of Bank Belgolaise and Bank BBL were searched. Spokesmen at both banks could not be reached by Reuters for comment.
Mobutu, has found refuge in Morocco since being ousted by Congo's new leader Laurent Kabila.
